names.name: Omojo
names.origin_story: Given to children believed to be direct blessings from the divine. In Igala tradition, such children are seen as messengers carrying divine purpose, born to fulfill a sacred destiny written in the stars.
names.related_proverb: The child of God walks with light in their eyes.

names.name: Ache
names.meaning: Female child born after her father's death
names.origin_story: A name wrapped in both sorrow and hope. Ache represents continuity—the spirit of the father living on through his daughter. She is the bridge between ancestors and the living.
names.related_proverb: When the great tree falls, its seed rises to touch the sky.

names.name: Okolo
names.origin_story: Named for children born during times when the family received unexpected assistance. Okolo carries the spirit of community—the belief that no one walks alone in Igala land.
names.related_proverb: The hand that helps builds the village.

names.name: Ugbane
names.origin_story: Reserved for children who arrive during desperate times—illness, famine, or conflict—bringing hope like rain after drought. Ugbane is destiny made flesh.
names.related_proverb: In the darkest hour, the saviour appears wearing light.

names.name: Ojonimi
names.origin_story: A profound declaration of faith. Given to children after answered prayers or miraculous survival. Ojonimi reminds all who hear it that life is sacred and borrowed from the Creator.
names.related_proverb: Life is a gift that returns to its giver.

names.name: Ojomugbo
names.origin_story: Whispered over children born in uncertain times. This name is a surrendered prayer—a trust that the path, though unseen, is already mapped by divine hands.
names.related_proverb: The river does not ask where it flows; it trusts the earth.

names.name: Ocholi
names.meaning: Strong child assumed to be strongest ever
names.origin_story: The name of warriors and kings. Ocholi is given to children who display unusual strength from birth—a cry that shakes the room, a grip that amazes elders. They are destined to lead.
names.related_proverb: The leopard's cub does not learn to roar—it is born with thunder.

names.name: Ufedo
names.origin_story: The purest of names. Given to children conceived in deep love or born to unite divided families. Ufedo walks through life spreading warmth wherever they go.
names.related_proverb: Love is the thread that weaves the village together.

names.name: Attah
names.origin_story: The most revered title in Igala land. Attah is both name and crown—given to children born into leadership lineage or destined to guide their people.
names.related_proverb: The Attah speaks once, and the village moves as one.

names.name: Abalaka
names.origin_story: Given to children born after promises were made or agreements fulfilled. Abalaka symbolizes integrity and the sacred bond of one's word.
names.related_proverb: A promise kept is stronger than iron.

names.name: Achimugwu
names.origin_story: Names the child as rightful heir, acknowledging the continuation of family legacy and ancestral blessings passed through generations.
names.related_proverb: What the father plants, the child harvests.

names.name: Aboh
names.origin_story: Given to curious children or those born after a mystery was solved. Aboh carries the spirit of discovery and truth-seeking.
names.related_proverb: The one who seeks will always find.

names.name: Achagba
names.meaning: Child is the bond between spouses
names.origin_story: Celebrates the child as the sacred union of mother and father. Achagba strengthens marriages and brings families closer together.
names.related_proverb: The child is the rope that binds two hearts.

names.name: Achegbulu
names.meaning: One who always does things by force
names.origin_story: Given to determined children who push through obstacles. Achegbulu never gives up and breaks barriers others cannot.
names.related_proverb: The persistent stream carves through stone.

names.name: Achemu
names.origin_story: A name of abundance and fertility. Given to children expected to bring prosperity and growth to the family.
names.related_proverb: Where one lamb grazes, many will follow.

names.name: Acheneje
names.origin_story: Sometimes given ironically or as a reminder. This name warns against deceit while acknowledging human nature.
names.related_proverb: The clever fox may run, but truth runs faster.

names.name: Achenyo
names.origin_story: Given to children born after acts of kindness or during times of blessing. Achenyo is expected to continue the legacy of good works.
names.related_proverb: Good deeds echo through generations.

names.name: Achonu
names.origin_story: A powerful name for those destined to shape leaders. Achonu may not wear the crown but determines who does.
names.related_proverb: Behind every great king stands a greater maker.

names.name: Achimi
names.origin_story: Given to children who provide spiritual protection to their families. Achimi is a shield against unseen forces.
names.related_proverb: Under the shelter of love, no storm can enter.

names.name: Adaji
names.meaning: Stream clearer/River blocker for catching fish
names.origin_story: Names the child as one who creates pathways and harvests abundance. Adaji clears obstacles and provides for the family.
names.related_proverb: The one who clears the stream feeds the village.

names.name: Adama
names.origin_story: A call for unity. Given to children born during reconciliation or community gatherings. Adama brings people together.
names.related_proverb: Together, the fingers form a mighty fist.

names.name: Adebo
names.origin_story: A sacred name connecting the child to ancestral worship and spiritual leadership. Adebo bridges the mortal and divine worlds.
names.related_proverb: The priest speaks, and the ancestors listen.

names.name: Adejo
names.origin_story: Celebrates community and togetherness. Adejo reminds everyone that strength lies in unity and collective spirit.
names.related_proverb: One tree does not make a forest.

names.name: Adegbe
names.origin_story: Given to hardworking children destined for agricultural success. Adegbe ensures the family table is always full.
names.related_proverb: The farmer's sweat waters tomorrow's harvest.

names.name: Adukwu
names.meaning: Child born without hope of survival but later survived all odds
names.origin_story: A miracle name. Adukwu defied death and proved that destiny cannot be denied. These children carry special purpose.
names.related_proverb: What is destined to live cannot be buried.

names.name: Agefu
names.origin_story: Given to intuitive children who perceive beyond the surface. Agefu understands people's true intentions.
names.related_proverb: The wise eye sees what the loud mouth hides.

names.name: Agbeju
names.origin_story: Celebrates intelligence and quick thinking. Agbeju solves problems others cannot comprehend.
names.related_proverb: Cleverness opens doors that strength cannot.

names.name: Agude
names.origin_story: Simple yet powerful. Agude embodies physical and mental strength, the foundation of Igala resilience.
names.related_proverb: Strength is not in the arm alone but in the spirit.

names.name: Ajanigo
names.meaning: Market has look/The market is watching
names.origin_story: A reminder that actions are observed. Given to children born during market days or to families known in trade.
names.related_proverb: What happens in the market reaches every ear.

names.name: Uchebo
names.origin_story: Extremely rare and spiritually significant. Children born with a caul are believed to possess special gifts and protection.
names.related_proverb: The veiled child sees both worlds.

names.name: Ajogwu
names.origin_story: The name of defenders and protectors. Ajogwu is born to fight for family, honor, and homeland.
names.related_proverb: The warrior's spirit never sleeps.

names.name: Ajuma
names.origin_story: Friday-born girls carry the blessing of preparation and gathering. Ajuma brings the family together before rest.
names.related_proverb: Friday's daughter prepares the feast of life.

names.name: Aladi
names.origin_story: Sunday represents new beginnings and divine rest. Aladi carries the blessing of fresh starts and peace.
names.related_proverb: Sunday's child walks in sacred light.

names.name: Laluba
names.origin_story: Wednesday-born girls are believed to be balanced and wise, standing at the center of the week's journey.
names.related_proverb: The middle path holds the greatest wisdom.

names.name: Alami
names.origin_story: Thursday-born daughters carry the energy of anticipation and readiness for what comes next.
names.related_proverb: Thursday's daughter sees tomorrow today.

names.name: Akoji
names.meaning: Representative, given to child born after father's death
names.origin_story: Akoji stands in place of the departed father, carrying forward his legacy and representing his spirit among the living.
names.related_proverb: The representative carries two hearts.

names.name: Akowe
names.origin_story: Given to children expected to be educated and literate. Akowe preserves knowledge and records history.
names.related_proverb: The pen outlives the sword.

names.name: Akogwu
names.origin_story: The keeper of stories and traditions. Akogwu remembers what others forget and teaches future generations.
names.related_proverb: The historian holds the village's soul.

names.name: Akpayi
names.origin_story: A declarative name announcing the child's arrival and significance. Akpayi commands attention and respect.
names.related_proverb: When this man speaks, silence follows.

names.name: Alewo
names.origin_story: Given to children whose mothers traveled far seeking healing during pregnancy. Alewo represents perseverance and the power of community.
names.related_proverb: The voice that travels returns with wisdom.

names.name: Alika
names.origin_story: Similar to Alewo, given to children born after their mothers journeyed far for healing. Alika embodies resilience.
names.related_proverb: The wanderer finds home in many places.

names.name: Alifeli
names.origin_story: A blessing name. Alifeli brings fortune wherever they go, turning bad situations into opportunities.
names.related_proverb: Luck follows those who prepare for it.

names.name: Amade
names.meaning: Take proper care and maintain rules and orders
names.origin_story: A name of discipline and responsibility. Amade maintains order and ensures things are done properly.
names.related_proverb: Order in the home brings peace to the land.

names.name: Ameh
names.origin_story: The wise one. Ameh is consulted for decisions and respected for deep understanding beyond their years.
names.related_proverb: Wisdom fills what strength cannot reach.

names.name: Anene
names.origin_story: A name connecting the child to the land and ancestors. Anene is rooted and grounded in tradition.
names.related_proverb: What belongs to the earth returns to it enriched.

names.name: Anone
names.origin_story: Blessed with community and connections. Anone never walks alone and has supporters everywhere.
names.related_proverb: The one with people is never poor.

names.name: Anoko
names.origin_story: A declaration of abundance. Anoko is destined for material and spiritual wealth.
names.related_proverb: True wealth is counted in hearts, not coins.

names.name: Anaja
names.origin_story: Born to stand out. Anaja commands respect through presence alone and is recognized wherever they go.
names.related_proverb: The distinguished one needs no introduction.

names.name: Atulukwu
names.meaning: The seed that reproduces never dies
names.origin_story: A profound statement of legacy. Atulukwu ensures the family line continues through generations.
names.related_proverb: The seed carries the forest within it.

names.name: Abimaje
names.origin_story: Given to fragile children who need extra care and prayers. Abimaje fights for life with every breath.
names.related_proverb: The fragile flame burns brightest when protected.

names.name: Ajigwu
names.origin_story: The unstoppable one. Ajigwu achieves goals through determination and refuses to accept defeat.
names.related_proverb: What force begins, will completes.

names.name: Ajifa
names.origin_story: Precious and valuable. Ajifa represents worth, purity, and the beauty that increases with time.
names.related_proverb: Silver shines brightest when polished by trials.

names.name: Akwu
names.origin_story: A name of expansion and influence. Akwu's impact reaches far and wide, touching many lives.
names.related_proverb: Like water, influence spreads to fill every space.

names.name: Ahiaba
names.meaning: Said no to depression, always fighting to succeed
names.origin_story: The overcomer. Ahiaba refuses to be defeated by circumstances and fights through every challenge.
names.related_proverb: The one who refuses to fall learns to fly.

names.name: Aneju
names.meaning: Expected, given to female child parents expected to be male
names.origin_story: A name of acceptance and surprise. Aneju proves that what arrives is always what was needed.
names.related_proverb: What we receive is greater than what we expect.

names.name: Aruwa
names.origin_story: Given to children who remind the family of lost loved ones. Aruwa keeps memories alive.
names.related_proverb: To remember is to keep the spirit breathing.

names.name: Ojochenemi
names.origin_story: A declaration of divine friendship. Ojochenemi walks with God as companion and protector.
names.related_proverb: When God is your person, who can stand against you?

names.name: Ojochide
names.origin_story: A shield name. Ojochide is covered by divine protection from all harm and evil.
names.related_proverb: Under God's shield, no arrow finds its mark.

names.name: Ojochogwu
names.origin_story: Given to children born after illness or to parents who experienced healing. God is the ultimate healer.
names.related_proverb: Divine medicine heals what human hands cannot.

names.name: Ebiojo
names.origin_story: A prayer answered. Ebiojo is the child that was specifically asked for and divinely granted.
names.related_proverb: What is requested from heaven comes wrapped in purpose.

names.name: Edegbo
names.origin_story: Courage personified. Edegbo faces fears and challenges with a heart that does not waver.
names.related_proverb: The brave heart beats for others, not itself.

names.name: Edogbanya
names.origin_story: Represents respect and tradition. Edogbanya embodies the wisdom passed down through greetings of elders.
names.related_proverb: The elder's greeting carries the weight of generations.

names.name: Edoeje
names.origin_story: The calm one. Edoeje waits with grace and understands that good things come to those who endure.
names.related_proverb: Patience cooks the toughest meat tender.

names.name: Ejura
names.origin_story: Born in happy times. Ejura brings joy and pleasure wherever they go, lifting spirits effortlessly.
names.related_proverb: Joy shared is joy multiplied.

names.name: Edibo
names.origin_story: Protector of royalty. Edibo is loyal, brave, and stands between danger and those they serve.
names.related_proverb: The royal guard sleeps with one eye open.

names.name: Ejima
names.origin_story: A sacred name for twins, who in Igala tradition carry special spiritual significance and blessings.
names.related_proverb: Twins share one soul in two bodies.

names.name: Egbunu
names.meaning: Child born with umbilical cord tied round neck, leg, or hand
names.origin_story: A survival name. Egbunu came into the world bound but broke free, signifying strength from birth.
names.related_proverb: What binds at birth frees in life.

names.name: Ekojonwa
names.origin_story: Everything according to divine design. Ekojonwa's life unfolds as heaven intended.
names.related_proverb: Man plans, but God's design prevails.

names.name: Eleojo
names.origin_story: A precious offering from above. Eleojo is treasured as a direct blessing from the Creator.
names.related_proverb: God's gifts come wrapped in mystery.

names.name: Ekele
names.origin_story: Simple declaration of gender, often given to long-awaited sons. Ekele carries the family name forward.
names.related_proverb: The son carries the father's torch.

names.name: Enemona
names.origin_story: A philosophical name acknowledging uncertainty. Enemona lives fully today without presuming tomorrow.
names.related_proverb: Tomorrow hides behind today's sunset.

names.name: Enebi
names.origin_story: Given to the last child or one born to complete the family. Enebi seals the family blessing.
names.related_proverb: The last fruit is often the sweetest.

names.name: Enenyo
names.origin_story: Goodness embodied. Enenyo is expected to live righteously and treat all people with kindness.
names.related_proverb: The good person leaves footprints of light.

names.name: Enefola
names.origin_story: A warning name, sometimes given to protect the child from mischief or as acknowledgment of spirited nature.
names.related_proverb: The one who seeks trouble finds more than expected.

names.name: Enemi
names.origin_story: The tireless one. Enemi is hardworking and never stops pursuing goals.
names.related_proverb: Rest comes after the harvest is complete.

names.name: Enejo
names.origin_story: One who walks with God. Enejo lives a life of faith, righteousness, and spiritual devotion.
names.related_proverb: The godly person's path is lit from within.

names.name: Ojimaojo
names.origin_story: Living testimony of God's glory. Ojimaojo's existence honors the Creator.
names.related_proverb: To honor God is to honor oneself.

names.name: Umola
names.origin_story: The learned one. Umola seeks and retains knowledge, becoming a resource for the community.
names.related_proverb: Knowledge without wisdom is a river without banks.

names.name: Etila
names.origin_story: A cautionary name, sometimes given to protect the child or acknowledge family challenges.
names.related_proverb: The wrong path teaches the value of the right one.

names.name: Eyimeje
names.meaning: This is our own so we must get it
names.origin_story: A declaration of possession and determination. Eyimeje claims what rightfully belongs to the family.
names.related_proverb: What is yours will find its way home.

names.name: Etimabo
names.origin_story: A mysterious name for children whose destiny puzzled even the diviners. Etimabo's path is unique.
names.related_proverb: Some destinies are written in invisible ink.

names.name: Enemakwu
names.origin_story: A protective declaration. Enemakwu is proclaimed to live long despite all challenges.
names.related_proverb: Words of life overcome shadows of death.

names.name: Fitumi
names.origin_story: Given during uncertain times or complicated births. Fitumi acknowledges life's mysteries.
names.related_proverb: Confusion is the beginning of clarity.

names.name: Ibe
names.origin_story: Pure wisdom distilled into a name. Ibe is expected to make wise decisions and guide others.
names.related_proverb: Wisdom is the crown that never fades.

names.name: Ichala
names.origin_story: The guardian. Ichala shields family and community from harm, standing as a wall of defense.
names.related_proverb: The protector's shadow keeps evil at bay.

names.name: Idaji
names.origin_story: Given to children who survived near-death experiences. Idaji is a living miracle.
names.related_proverb: The one who returns from death brings messages from beyond.

names.name: Idakwo
names.origin_story: Authority and responsibility combined. Idakwo leads the household with wisdom and care.
names.related_proverb: The father's word builds the house's foundation.

names.name: Idachaba
names.origin_story: Given to children who have reason to hold their heads high. Idachaba walks with justified pride.
names.related_proverb: Pride in one's roots grows the tallest tree.

names.name: Idajili
names.origin_story: Mystical and profound. Idajili carries visions from the threshold between life and death.
names.related_proverb: The eyes that see death understand life.

names.name: Idoko
names.origin_story: Celebrates agricultural heritage. Idoko is connected to the land and the honest work of farming.
names.related_proverb: The farmer's footprints feed the village.

names.name: Iganya
names.origin_story: One who draws admiration naturally. Iganya's character and presence inspire others.
names.related_proverb: The admirable person needs no decoration.

names.name: Ikojo
names.origin_story: Everything in divine timing. Ikojo arrives exactly when meant to, fulfilling heavenly schedule.
names.related_proverb: God's time is perfect, never early, never late.

names.name: Ikani
names.origin_story: Acknowledges uncertainty. Ikani represents possibilities and the open nature of destiny.
names.related_proverb: In 'maybe' lies infinite possibility.

names.name: Ileje
names.origin_story: Philosophical acceptance that not everyone will approve. Ileje lives authentically regardless.
names.related_proverb: The world's disagreement cannot stop destiny.

names.name: Iyoma
names.meaning: Reincarnation of mother to become child
names.origin_story: Sacred reincarnation. Iyoma is believed to carry the spirit of a departed mother returned to her family.
names.related_proverb: The mother never truly leaves; she returns in new form.

names.name: Itodo
names.origin_story: Given during difficult times when the family faced constraints. Itodo represents overcoming bondage.
names.related_proverb: What is held will one day be released.

names.name: Ichado
names.origin_story: A warning name about the seriousness of oaths. Ichado respects the power of spoken commitments.
names.related_proverb: The oath binds tighter than any rope.

names.name: Idegwu
names.meaning: The owner of the case faces it when it reaches court
names.origin_story: Justice-related name. Idegwu believes in accountability and facing consequences.
names.related_proverb: Every case finds its rightful owner.

names.name: Obaje
names.meaning: Tiny colourful object design with attraction
names.origin_story: Beautiful and eye-catching. Obaje draws attention through their unique and colorful presence.
names.related_proverb: Small beauty catches the greatest eye.

names.name: Oboni
names.origin_story: A special birth mark. In Igala tradition, extra fingers signify special gifts and purpose.
names.related_proverb: Extra fingers count extra blessings.

names.name: Obaka
names.origin_story: Connected to the rainbow, a sacred sign. Obaka carries divine promises and hope after storms.
names.related_proverb: The rainbow commands; the storm obeys.

names.name: Odoma
names.origin_story: Represents community and belonging. Odoma creates spaces where people feel at home.
names.related_proverb: Where good people live becomes sacred ground.

names.name: Ogala
names.origin_story: The unwavering guide. Ogala leads with certainty and never loses direction or purpose.
names.related_proverb: The true leader's compass points to truth.

names.name: Omebije
names.origin_story: Unbreakable strength. Omebije withstands pressure that would break others.
names.related_proverb: Iron bends but never breaks under fire.

names.name: Omachonu
names.origin_story: Celebrates the royalty of children. Omachonu reminds that children are the greatest treasure.
names.related_proverb: In the child's laughter, kingdoms are built.

names.name: Onechojo
names.origin_story: A humbling reminder. Onechojo acknowledges human limitations before the divine.
names.related_proverb: The wisest human is still learning.

names.name: Onaji
names.origin_story: Given during times of obstacle. Onaji represents the challenge that must be overcome.
names.related_proverb: When one road blocks, another opens.

names.name: Ogwuche
names.origin_story: Celebration of healing. Ogwuche is born after successful treatment or recovery.
names.related_proverb: The medicine that works brings dancing.

names.name: Onoja
names.origin_story: Beloved leader. Onoja rules through the love and support of the people.
names.related_proverb: The people's king wears the heaviest crown.

names.name: Onalo
names.origin_story: Pathways open. Onalo finds ways where others see walls.
names.related_proverb: Clear roads await those who step forward.

names.name: Okayi
names.origin_story: Sometimes given as a reminder or warning about deception in life's journey.
names.related_proverb: The tricked today teaches tomorrow.

names.name: Okpanachi
names.meaning: At a particular period/In due season
names.origin_story: Timing is everything. Okpanachi arrived at exactly the right moment in family history.
names.related_proverb: Every season brings its own harvest.

names.name: Opaluwa
names.origin_story: The chain continues. Opaluwa ensures the family name and legacy live on.
names.related_proverb: The family tree grows through each new branch.

categories.name: Spiritual
categories.description: Names connected to divine purpose and faith

categories.name: Circumstantial
categories.description: Names given based on birth circumstances

categories.name: Family
categories.description: Names related to family bonds and lineage

categories.name: Day-Born
categories.description: Names based on the day of birth

categories.name: Occupational
categories.description: Names related to work and profession
